title: On characteristic elements modulo $p$ in non-commutative Iwasawa theory
abstract:
Coates, Fukaya, Kato, Sujatha and Venjakob come up with a procedure of
attaching suitable characteristic element to Selmer groups defined over a
non-commutative $p$-adic Lie extension, which is subsequently refined by Burns
and Venjakob. By their construction, these characteristic elements are realized
as elements in an appropriate localized $K_1$-group. In this paper, we will
introduce a notion of modulo $p$ for these elements and study some of their
properties. As an application, we study the Greenberg Selmer group of a tensor
product of modular forms, where $p$ is an Eisenstein prime for one of these
forms.
